item.title: british american tobacco dropped from u.s. case

item.description: with rafael soriano being shut down, sabathia gave the bullpen a needed day off, and the yankees scored two runs in the eighth and two more with two outs in the ninth.

item.title: nancy pelosi briefly hospitalized in rome
item.description: house of representatives democratic leader nancy pelosi was released from a short stay in a hospital on monday and is resuming her scheduled activities in italy, spokesman nadeam elshami said.

item.title: miami ready to turn up heat in bid for championship

item.description: rain added to the misery of those in several southern states trying to salvage what they could from homes badly damaged by deadly twisters.

item.title: u.n. plane crashes in congo, 10 dead: u.n. source

item.title: unhcr praises open borders for libyans, ivorians

item.title: lagarde likely to be next imf chief: report

item.description: douglas h. shulman, the commissioner of the internal revenue service, apologized to three identity theft victims who said they were treated rudely by i.r.s. employees.

item.description: a suicide bomber killed 24 people in pakistan on thursday in the latest militant attack since the death of osama bin laden which has angered pakistan and led to a call for the united states to withdraw some of its military trainers.

item.title: clinton calls on pakistan to do more against militants
item.description: u.s. secretary of state hillary clinton said on friday pakistan needed to take decisive steps against islamist militancy and that relations between the two allies, tense since the killing of osama bin laden, had reached a turning point.

item.title: two insurgents killed during battle in afghanistan

item.title: kazakh leader set for easy re-election
item.description: kazakhstan's veteran president nursultan nazarbayev is poised to win another five years in charge of his oil-rich central asian state after a snap election on sunday devoid of any challenge to his two decades in power.
